article:
]] ]] ]] at the Expo 2010]] A 'world's fair', 'world fair', 'world exposition'
or 'universal exposition' (sometimes spelled expo for short) is a large public
exhibition. These exhibitions vary in character and are held in varying parts of
the world. The next World's fair will be Expo 2015 in Milan, Italy.

Since the entering into force of the 1928 Convention Relating to International
Exhibitions, the Bureau International des Expositions (BIE; ) has served as an
international sanctioning body for world's fairs. BIE-approved fairs are of
three types: universal, international, and specialized. They usually last from
three weeks to six months.
